name: Culver, Carroll Nelson
connectionToPtLawrence: Carroll Culver built and ran a fishing resort (Pt. Lawrence Lodge) at Pt. Lawrence during the 1930s, 40s, and 50s.

immediateFamily.sonOf: Otis Henry Culver and Mabel Gertrude Smith
immediateFamily.fatherOf: Ken Culver, Bruce Culver, Carolyn (Culver) Leonhardt
immediateFamily.brotherOf: Evelyn Louise Culver, Leda Gertrude Culver, Mabel Florian Culver, and Mary Luella Culver

about:
For over 60 years Carroll Culver was a prominent member of the Doe Bay community. He built and ran Point Lawrence Lodge successfully for over 30 years. His wit and charisma made him popular as a master of ceremonies at potluck dinners and Fourth of July celebrations. In the early 1960s the depletion of the salmon runs by commercial operators caused many sport fishing resorts to close their doors. Carroll retired and, over a period of years, built a new home at Shorewood. His carpentry skills inspired a number of his neighbors to become do-it-yourself summer homebuilders.

Source: Doe Bay Historical Images and Favorite Recipes

inTheNews.content: "O.H. Culver, veteran customs inspector at Bellingham, and Mrs. Culver, returned Saturday evening from a five weeks' trip East, during which they travelled in twenty states and in two Canadian provinces, Ontario and Quebec. They also spent a few hours in Washington D.C. It was their first trip East in eight years. In New York City, the couple met their son, Carroll, a member of the crew of the Pacific American FIsheries' steamship Mary D., now en route from that city, where she delivered lumber. In Vermont, they visited Mrs. Culver's sister, and in Milwaukee they spent several days with their oldest daughter, Mrs. Evelyn Watson.

miscellaneous:
Letter from George Nelson Culver to O.H. and Mabel Culver on the Occasion of Carroll's Birth (April 10, 1904)

Dear folks,

We all rejoice with exceeding joy in the heartiest of hearty sympanthy with you on the coming of him whom we anticipate will perpetuate the good name and honor of his honorable parentage.
